content:
That's great to hear that reading during your commute has a positive impact on your productivity and focus!

As for book clubs and online forums, there are many wonderful communities out there. You might want to check out Goodreads, which is a fantastic platform for book lovers. You can join groups, participate in discussions, and get personalized recommendations based on your reading preferences.

If you're interested in online book clubs, you might enjoy platforms like Book of the Month or Literary Guild, which offer curated book selections and online discussions. You could also look into Facebook groups or Reddit forums dedicated to specific genres or topics, like r/books or r/Fantasy.

Additionally, many authors and publishers have their own online communities or newsletters where they share updates, behind-the-scenes insights, and exclusive content. You might want to explore those as well, especially if you have a favorite author or series.

Lastly, if you're looking for a more local book club experience, you could try searching for book clubs in your area through Meetup.com or local libraries. Many libraries also offer book clubs or reading groups, which can be a great way to meet fellow readers and discuss books in person.

Do you think you'll explore any of these options, or do you have a different way of discovering new books and connecting with fellow readers?
